other_tests.findings: Poor quality owing to severe pectus excavatum.
Restrictive pattern with vital capacity of 2.50 L (66% of predicted) and total lung capacity of 3.32 L (65% of predicted).
Documented drop in both blood pressure and pulse wave amplitude; loss of consciousness at 2 minutes and 30 seconds.
Marked compression of the inferior vena cava at end expiration and increased mean flow velocity at end expiration with a blunted flow pattern.
Anterior-posterior intrathoracic distance of 1.2 cm, pectus severity index of 18.8 (severe).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Marked improvement in minimal expiratory thoracic depth from 1.2 cm to 5.7 cm post-surgery.
